ai-pipeline-intro.text: User Input. Everything begins with you - the user. Your intent, your question, your goal.
The Prompt. Your intent becomes a prompt - carefully crafted instructions that tell the AI what you need.
Context. Context is the secret sauce. It gives the AI the background it needs to truly understand.
The LLM. The large language model receives your prompt and context, processing them together.
The Response. And out comes the response - shaped by how well you crafted the input. Now it's your turn to connect the flow!

rag-pipeline-intro.text: Your Query. It starts with a question - something you need answered using your own data.
Embeddings. Your query gets converted into a numerical vector - a mathematical representation of meaning.
Vector Database. This vector searches a database of pre-embedded documents, finding the most similar matches.
Retrieved Documents. The most relevant documents are pulled out - your grounding context for the answer.
The LLM. The language model receives both your original query AND the retrieved documents together.
Grounded Answer. The result? An answer grounded in your actual data - not hallucinated. Now wire up the RAG pipeline!

agent-loop-intro.text: Observe. The agent begins by observing its environment - what's the current state of the world?
Think. With observations in hand, the agent thinks - reasoning about what it sees.
Plan. Thinking leads to planning - deciding the next steps to achieve the goal.
Act. The agent takes action, executing part of its plan.
Tools. Actions often use tools - APIs, databases, code execution - extending what the agent can do.
Memory. Results get stored in memory, informing future decisions. And the loop continues! Now connect the cycle.
